conclusion: Analyze the flow paths from points A, B, and C to determine which container the liquid will flow into.
Liquid flows downwards from point A and hits the first baffle.
Liquid flows to the right from the first baffle and hits the second baffle.
Liquid flows downwards from the second baffle and hits the third baffle.
Liquid flows to the right from the third baffle and enters container D.
Liquid flows downwards from point B and hits the first baffle.
Liquid flows to the right from the first baffle and hits the second baffle.
Liquid flows downwards from the second baffle and hits the third baffle.
Liquid flows to the right from the third baffle and enters container D.
Liquid flows downwards from point C and hits the first baffle.
Liquid flows to the right from the first baffle and hits the second baffle.
Liquid flows downwards from the second baffle and hits the third baffle.
Liquid flows to the right from the third baffle and enters container D.
The liquid from points A, B, and C will all flow into container D after passing through the baffles.
